title: Great Beers of the World
name: Great Beers of the World
description:
A Map by Philocer

Best beer places in the world. Mark you, the local bud watering hole may be not eligible for entry. But famous microbreweries and mainstays like Oktoberfest or the Guiness brewers might.

properties.name: El Bosq de les Fades Lat,Long: 41.37721,2.17726
properties.description: Posted by Philocer A whacks, weird, cozy place in Disneyland fantasy style. Pretty dark in some places, but utterly benign. The beer is OK, a nice little selection. A good place to go.

properties.name: Andechs Monastery beergarden and brewery Lat,Long: 47.97422,11.18358
properties.description: Posted by Philocer

properties.name: Augustiner brewery and beergarden Lat,Long: 48.13917,11.54567
properties.description: Posted by Philocer Augustiner Keller beergarden and brewery. One of Munich big beers. Methinks it the best, but that\'s for you to decide.

properties.name: Eittinger Fischerbräu Brewery Lat,Long: 48.36167,11.88684
properties.description: Posted by PhilocerEittinger Fischerbräu brewery. Very quaint in rural Bavaria. Stop by there! Not so far from the airport at that...

properties.name: Franciscan Well Brewery Lat,Long: 51.90099,-8.4822
properties.description: Posted by Philocer The Franciscan Well brewery. Home of some fine beers, most notably the Friar Weisse, the best wheat beer I ever tasted out of Bavaria. Funny mixture of Irish and Bavarian beergarden.

properties.name: Garching Beergarden Lat,Long: 48.24621,11.66136
properties.description: Posted by Philocer

properties.name: Guinness Storehouse Lat,Long: 53.34287,-6.2871
properties.description: Posted by Philocer The Guinness Storehouse (for tourist visitors) and brewery. Guinness is not Ireland\'s best beer, nor is this the best tourist brewery experience you can have (go to Boston for that), but it\'s OK for an afternoon off. Temple bar isn\'t that far either.

properties.name: Heartland Brewery at Union Square, Lat,Long: 40.73644,-73.991
properties.description: Posted by Philocer Heartland has a couple of locations in NY. I chose this one because the other ones frankly suck (well, except 6th Ave. That one\'s OK). Heartland does decent beer, and though it\'s crowded as hell sometimes, it offers a sort-of-cozy place for a refreshing pint. Check out the "Black Bavarian"

properties.name: Hofbräuhaus Lass Vegas Lat,Long: 36.1078,-115.15166
properties.description: Posted by Philocer Las Vegas Hofbräuhaus. Pretty close to the original thing in Munich, and with really decent beer. They used to offer a free shuttle to the strip, don\'t know if they still do.

properties.name: Hofbräuhaus Munich Lat,Long: 48.13759,11.58042
properties.description: Posted by Philocer The Munich Hofbräuhaus, one of the city landmarks. Though touristed up some, it still has a nice quaintness to it, especially in the beergarden. Don\'t miss it when in Munich.

properties.name: Oktoberfest Lat,Long: 48.13482,11.54989
properties.description: Posted by Philocer

properties.name: Pittsfield Brew Works Lat,Long: 42.45024,-73.25387
properties.description: Posted by Philocer

properties.name: SLO brewing company Lat,Long: 35.27954,-120.66389
properties.description: Posted by PhilocerSLO Brewing Company - a decent microbrewery that I really enjoyed visiting.

properties.name: Samuel Adams brewery Lat,Long: 42.3146,-71.10257
properties.description: Posted by Philocer Now this is what I call a good brewery tour. Fun, not too long, not too touristy, and you get to taste beers from their workshop. We got a totally weird but strangely attractive triple-yeasted variety which was an experience all by itself. Go there!

properties.name: Spaten Brewery Munich
properties.description: Posted by Garlynn Marsstr. 16, 80335 München, GermanyThe home of Spaten, a brewery which is hundreds of years old and still produces one of the better dopplebocks anywhere, despite its status as the second-largest German export brewery.

properties.name: Triple Rock Brewery/Pub
properties.description: Posted by Garlynn1920 shattuck ave, berkeley, caClaiming to be one of the first five brewpubs in the United States, this is at least one of the first five in Berkeley. Their beer is decently good, depending on what they have on their rotation, and their food isn\'t half-bad, either, though it tends to be a bit on the expensive side for standard pub fare. The upstairs patio is a nice touch. The sports TVs everywhere could go. Surprisingly, given its proximity to the UC Berkeley campus, it is not always over-run by frat-belonging sports-fan students.
